hero.title: Revolutionize your scrim experience
hero.description: Using our platform, you can visualize your scrim data, track individual player performance, and more. Invite your players to your team and allow them to see their stats.

logoCloud.title: Used by a variety of teams for stat tracking

feature1.subtitle: Improve faster
feature1.title: Everything you need to improve your team performance
feature1.description: Streamline your improvement process with our platform. Gain insight into your players' and teams' strengths and weaknesses. See their biggest areas of improvement and adjust your coaching accordingly.

builtByCoaches.name: Built by coaches, for coaches
builtByCoaches.description: Designed with collegiate and professional coaches in mind. Our platform is built to help you understand trends and patterns in your team's performance.

shareWithTeam.name: Share with your team
shareWithTeam.description: Invite your players to your team and allow them to see their stats. Share your team's stats with your players and coaches. Keep everyone in the loop.

advancedStatistics.name: Advanced statistics
advancedStatistics.description: Gain insight into your players' performance over time. Track their stats and see how they improve. See trends and patterns week over week.

feature2.subtitle: Everything you need
feature2.title: Scrim stats at your fingertips
feature2.description: See your stats after your scrims instead of only relying on replay codes. Our platform allows you to keep your data no matter what happens to your replays.

dataCharts.name: Player and team data charts.
dataCharts.description: Visualize your team's stats. See what can be improved and where your team is excelling. Understand your team's strengths and weaknesses.

filterStats.name: Filter stats by time.
filterStats.description: See your team's stats over time. Filter by week, month, or year to see how your team is improving.

userProfiles.name: User profiles.
userProfiles.description: See individual player stats and trends over time. Understand how your players are improving and where they need help.

advancedSecurity.name: Advanced security.
advancedSecurity.description: User accounts do not store passwords. Only users you invite to your team can see your team's scrims.

fastReliable.name: Fast and reliable.
fastReliable.description: We're built on top of the latest cloud infrastructure. Speed is never an issue. We're always up and running.

fullyCustomizable.name: Fully customizable.
fullyCustomizable.description: Need custom functionality or want to track specific metrics? Let us know and we'll make it happen.

stats.subtitle: Our track record
stats.title: Trusted by the best
stats.description: We're proud to work with top teams and coaches to create better experiences for everyone. Our platform is built to suit the needs of collegiate and professional teams.

testimonial.quote: “Parsertime is an incredible way to check out statistics in Overwatch scrims. It got me to understand more about statistics in general and really get interested in data science, which I now do for four teams (using Parsertime). The information it provides is so impactful that my players can be coached on things they actively need help with, like surviving longer, holding their ultimate abilities longer, and being more patient. Maybe their healing numbers are lower than the other support, so we can look at why. It's a fantastic tool that helps obtain a wider range of data to lock in on a closer field of view.”
testimonial.author: coy (@shy.coy)

cta.subtitle: Ready to get started?
cta.title: Start using our app today.
cta.description: Sign up and start using our platform today. We're excited to change the way you think about coaching.

errors.verification: The token has expired or has already been used. Please try again.

errors.default: There was an unknown error signing in. Please contact support.

mapMetadata.title: {mapName} Overview | Parsertime
mapMetadata.description: Map overview for {mapName} on Parsertime. Parsertime is a tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.
mapMetadata.ogDescription: Map overview for {mapName} on Parsertime. Parsertime is a tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.

playerMetadata.title: {playerName} Overview | Parsertime
playerMetadata.description: Player overview for {playerName} on Parsertime. Parsertime is a tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.
playerMetadata.ogDescription: Player overview for {playerName} on Parsertime. Parsertime is a tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.

overview.fletaDescription: A Fleta Deadlift is when a player earns 50% of their team's final blows.
overview.firstPickDescription: Out of {fights} fights, {player} got the first pick {picks, plural, =1 {# time} other {# times}}.
overview.firstDeathDescription: Out of {fights} fights, {player} died first {deaths, plural, =1 {# time} other {# times}}.

avgUltChargeTime.title: Average Ultimate Charge Time
avgUltChargeTime.footer: The average time it takes to build an ultimate. A lower time is better, while a longer time might indicate that you are not doing enough damage or healing.

avgTimeUseUlt.title: Average Time to Use Ultimate
avgTimeUseUlt.footer: The average time it takes to use an ultimate after it's charged. A longer time might indicate that you are not using your ultimate effectively or are holding onto it for too long.

avgDroughtTime.title: Average Drought Time
avgDroughtTime.footer: The drought time is the average time between your most recent kill and your next kill. A high drought time can indicate that you are not participating in fights as often as you should be.

xFactor.title: X Factor
xFactor.footer: The X Factor is a measure of a player's individual impact on a fight. If your X Factor is high, you are likely to be the deciding factor in a fight. Please note that this is calculated differently for each role.

versus.title: Versus Other Players
versus.description: {playerName}'s score and winrates against players on the enemy team.

playerKillfeed.title: Player Killfeed
playerKillfeed.description: A list of all the final blows and deaths for {playerName} in this match. Fights where {playerName} did not get a final blow are not shown.

dmgTakenHealingReceived.title: Damage Taken vs Healing Received
dmgTakenHealingReceived.footer: This chart shows the cumulative damage taken and healing received by round. The x-axis represents the round number, and the y-axis represents the cumulative damage taken or healing received.

dmgDoneDmgTaken.title: Hero Damage Dealt vs Damage Taken
dmgDoneDmgTaken.footer: This chart shows the hero damage dealt and damage taken by round. The x-axis represents the round number, and the y-axis represents the damage dealt or damage taken.

mvpScore.title: MVP Score
mvpScore.footer: The MVP score is a calculation based on a player's statistics compared to the averages of all other players who have played the same hero in scrims. Hover over this card to see how the MVP score is calculated.
mvpScore.percentile: {percentile, selectordinal, one {#st} two {#nd} few {#rd} other {#th}} percentile
mvpScore.explanation: The MVP score can be used to understand how a player is performing compared to similar players on their hero. The MVP stat does not take into account a player's performance compared to their teammates—it is a way to see who is having a stand-out performance compared to the global averages on their hero. MVP scores typically range between -100 and +100, with a normal distribution centered around 0.

dmgByRound.title: Hero Damage By Round
dmgByRound.footer: This chart shows the hero damage done by round for {playerName}. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the damage done. Note that the damage is NOT cumulative, so the damage done in round 2 does not include the damage done in round 1.

dmgBlockByRound.title: Damage Mitigated By Round
dmgBlockByRound.footer: This chart shows the damage mitigated by round for {playerName}. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the healing done. Note that the healing is NOT cumulative, so the healing done in round 2 does not include the healing done in round 1.

finalBlowsByRound.title: Final Blows By Round
finalBlowsByRound.footer: This chart shows the final blows by round for {playerName}. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the healing done. Note that the healing is NOT cumulative, so the healing done in round 2 does not include the healing done in round 1.

healingByRound.title: Healing By Round
healingByRound.footer: This chart shows the healing done by round for {playerName}. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the healing done. Note that the healing is NOT cumulative, so the healing done in round 2 does not include the healing done in round 1.

dmgTakenByRound.title: Damage Taken By Round
dmgTakenByRound.footer: This chart shows the damage taken by round for {playerName}. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the healing done. Note that the healing is NOT cumulative, so the healing done in round 2 does not include the healing done in round 1.

healingReceivedByRound.title: Healing Received By Round
healingReceivedByRound.footer: This chart shows the healing received by round for {playerName}. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the healing done. Note that the healing is NOT cumulative, so the healing done in round 2 does not include the healing done in round 1.

tiptap.placeholder: Write, format, and highlight your text below.

overview.pushLimitations: Not supported for Push due to limitations with the scrim code. :(
overview.dealtMore: <color>{teamName}</color> dealt more hero damage this map.
overview.title: Overview

analysis.title: Analysis
analysis.deathDescriptionTeam1: <span1>{team1Name}</span1> had a first death in {team1FirstDeaths} fights, which is a percentage of <span2>{percentage}</span2>%.
analysis.deathDescriptionTeam2: <span1>{team2Name}</span1> had a first death in {team2FirstDeaths} fights, which is a percentage of <span2>{percentage}</span2>%.
analysis.ultKillsDescriptionTeam1: {team1Name} got the most value out of their ultimates, with {team1UltimateKills} ultimate kills.
analysis.ultKillsDescriptionTeam2: {team2Name} got the most value out of their ultimates, with {team2UltimateKills} ultimate kills.
analysis.ultKillsDescriptionBoth: Both teams got the same amount of value out of their ultimates, with {team1UltimateKills} ultimate kills each.
analysis.playerDeathDescription: The player with the most first deaths was {playerWithMostFirstDeaths}, with {firstDeaths} first deaths out of {fights} fights.
analysis.ajax: {player} played Lúcio this map and Ajaxed {ajaxes} {ajaxes, plural, one {time} other {times}}.

tooltips.playerName: The player's name. Click on their name to view their statistics.
tooltips.playerTeam: The team the player played for.
tooltips.eliminations: The number of eliminations the player had.
tooltips.kills: The number of final blows the player had.
tooltips.assists: The number of assists the player had.
tooltips.deaths: The number of deaths the player had.
tooltips.heroDmgDealt: The amount of hero damage the player dealt.
tooltips.dmgReceived: The amount of damage the player received.
tooltips.healingReceived: The amount of healing the player received.
tooltips.healingDealt: The amount of healing the player dealt.
tooltips.dmgToHealsRatio: The player's damage dealt to healing received ratio.
tooltips.ultsCharged: The number of ultimates the player charged.
tooltips.ultsUsed: The number of ultimates the player used.

charts.tooltip: Looking for more information on charts? <link>Check out the documentation</link> to learn more.

killsByFight.title: Kills By Fight
killsByFight.description: Kills are grouped by 15 second intervals. This chart shows the cumulative kills for each team at each interval. The x-axis represents the time in seconds, and the y-axis represents the cumulative kills. Team 1 is represented with positive numbers, while Team 2 is represented with negative numbers. The chart resets to 0 after each fight.

finalBlowsByRole.title: Final Blows By Role
finalBlowsByRole.description: This chart shows the number of final blows by role for each team. The roles are split into Tank, Damage, and Support. The x-axis represents the role, and the y-axis represents the number of final blows.

dmgByRound.title: Cumulative Hero Damage By Round
dmgByRound.description: This chart shows the hero damage done by round for each team. The x-axis represents the round, and the y-axis represents the damage done. Note that the damage is cumulative, so the damage done in round 2 includes the damage done in round 1.

mapEvents.title: Events
mapEvents.description: Events that occurred during the match. This includes objective captures, rounds starting and ending, multikills, and more.
mapEvents.ultKills: {player} killed {players, plural, =1 {one player} other {# players}} with/during their ultimate.
mapEvents.multikill: During fight {event}, {player} got a multikill, killing {kills} players.

ultsUsed.title: Ultimates Used
ultsUsed.description: A list of all ultimates used during the match and the times when they occurred.

teamInviteLink.description: Please note that inviting a user via the "Invite User" button is much more secure. We suggest avoiding sharing this link whenever possible.

handleCrop.title: Avatar updated successfully

convenience.name: Convenience.
convenience.description: Make it easy to track stats and see trends over time. Easily diagnose issues with your players.

accessibility.name: Accessibility.
accessibility.description: We want to make it easy for any team to use Parsertime. We're always looking for ways to make the platform more accessible.

community.name: Community first.
community.description: Built by Overwatch players, for Overwatch players. We're dedicated to serving the community.

openSource.name: Open source.
openSource.description: We believe that the best tools are built in the open. Contributions are welcome!

improvement.name: Continuous improvement.
improvement.description: We're always adding new features and improving the platform. We want to make the best app possible.

reliable.name: Reliable and performant.
reliable.description: Our platform is built to be fast and reliable. We want to make sure that it's always there for you.

team.notPictured: Not pictured: <name>Devraj Ambala</name>, Engineering Intern, Summer 2024; <name>Karson Miller</name>, Engineering Intern, Summer 2024; and <name>Rose Thatch</name>, Engineering Intern, Summer 2024.

headerSection.title: We love Overwatch
headerSection.description: That's why we're building a better way to track your performance. See your team's stats, track your performance over time, and see how you evolve as a player and as a team.

contentSection.description1: Parsertime was originally created as an internal tool for FIU Panthers, a collegiate team. We wanted to be able to see our stats after scrims and see trends over time. We've since expanded to become a platform that any team can use. We're excited to see how teams use Parsertime to improve their performance.
contentSection.description2: We're a small team of passionate Overwatch players and coaches who are dedicated to building a platform that works for your team. We're always looking for feedback and feature requests. If you have any ideas, we'd love to hear them!
contentSection.description3: We know that teams are always looking for ways to improve. Our goal is to make it easy for you to see your stats and see trends week over week. Parsertime is currently used internally at FIU and new features are being added every week. We want to provide the best experience possible for Overwatch players and teams.
contentSection.description4: Parsertime is fully open source. We believe that the best tools are built in the open. If you'd like to contribute to Parsertime, we'd love to have you! We're always looking for contributors to help us build the best platform for Overwatch teams. You can find our GitHub repo <link>here</link>.

featureSection.title: Our features
featureSection.description: See how our platform can make a difference for your team.

teamSection.title: Meet our team
teamSection.description: We're a small team of passionate Overwatch players and coaches who are dedicated to building a platform that works for your team.

ctaSection.title: Boost your productivity.
ctaSection.subtitle: Start using our app today.
ctaSection.description: Give your team the tools they need to succeed. Sign up for Parsertime today.

footerNav.title: Footer
footerNav.description: Building a better way to track your Overwatch performance.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.header: Plans for teams of all sizes
pricing.description: As your team grows, Parsertime grows with you. We have the tools and features to meet your needs.

tiers.freeDescription: For people who want to try out Parsertime.
tiers.basicDescription: For teams that are ready to grow with Parsertime.
tiers.premiumDescription: For larger teams that want to take their productivity to the next level.

caseStudy.title: Learn how teams use Parsertime to improve their coaching strategy.

testimonial.quote: “Parsertime is so impactful to the point where my players can be coached on things they actively need help with, like living more, or holding their ult longer and being patient.”
testimonial.author: coy (@shy.coy)

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.description: Can't find the answer you're looking for? Reach out to our <link>support</link> team.
faq.question1: Do you offer discounts for collegiate teams?
faq.answer1: Yes! Please reach out to our support team and we'll be happy to help.
faq.question2: Do you offer discounts for Calling All Heroes teams?
faq.answer2: Yes! We want to support the CAH community as much as possible. Please reach out to our support team and we'll be happy to discuss a solution.
faq.question3: How can I manage my subscription?
faq.answer3: You can manage your subscription <link>here</link>. If you have any issues, please reach out to our support team.
faq.question4: Can I cancel my subscription at any time?
faq.answer4: Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time. Your subscription will remain active until the end of the billing period.
faq.question5: What if I need higher limits than the Premium plan offers?
faq.answer5: If you need something special or require higher limits than the Premium plan offers, please reach out to our <link>support team</link> and we'll be happy to discuss a custom solution.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Parsertime
metadata.description: Privacy Policy for Parsertime - A tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.
metadata.ogDescription: Privacy Policy for Parsertime - A tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.description: At Parsertime, we are committed to maintaining the trust and confidence of our visitors to our web site. In particular, we want you to know that Parsertime is not in the business of selling, renting, or trading email lists with other companies and businesses for marketing purposes. In this Privacy Policy, we've provided detailed information on when and why we collect your personal information, how we use it, and how we keep it secure.

collectInformation.title: Information We Collect
collectInformation.description: As part of the registration process for our web app, we collect personal information. We use that information for a couple of reasons: to tell you about stuff you've asked us to tell you about; to contact you if we need to obtain or provide additional information; to check our records are right and to check every now and then that you're happy and satisfied. Here are the types of information we collect:

email.title: Email Addresses
email.description: Your email address is required during the registration process to help with account creation, authentication, and necessary communication related to the functionality of the app. We do not use your email address for marketing purposes.

picture.title: Profile Pictures and Team Images
picture.description: You can upload a profile picture and team images. These images are used to personalize your account and team profiles within our application.

data.title: Game Logs and Performance Data
data.description: Overwatch 2 to visualize stats and show data on user and team performance. This data is strictly used to provide services offered by Parsertime and does not include any personally sensitive information.

useInformation.title: How We Use Your Information
useInformation.list2: Improve your experience on our site through personalization;
useInformation.list3: Communicate important notices, such as changes to our terms, conditions, and policies;
useInformation.list4: Address technical issues and protect our site from fraud and abuse.

storageSecurity.title: Storage and Security
storageSecurity.description: We take precautions to protect your information. When you submit sensitive information via the website, your information is protected both online and offline. Only employees who need the information to perform a specific job (for example, billing or customer service) are granted access to personally identifiable information.

thirdPartyLinks.title: Third-Party Links
thirdPartyLinks.description: Our website may include links to third-party websites. We do not have control over, and are not responsible for, the content or privacy practices of these sites. We encourage our users to be aware when they leave our site and to read the privacy statements of any other site that collects personally identifiable information.

changePrivacyPolicy.title: Changes to Our Privacy Policy
changePrivacyPolicy.description: We may update this policy from time to time in order to reflect, for example, changes to our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons.

contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.description: For more information about our privacy practices, if you have questions, or if you would like to make a complaint, please contact us by email at <link>privacy@lux.dev</link>.

metadata.title: Terms of Service | Parsertime
metadata.description: Terms of Service for Parsertime - A tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.
metadata.ogDescription: Terms of Service for Parsertime - A tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.description: These Terms of Service govern your use of Parsertime, an open source tool for analyzing Overwatch scrims. By accessing or using our service, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.description: By accessing and using this website, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement. If you do not agree to abide by the above, please do not use this service.

openSource.title: Open Source License
openSource.description: Parsertime is released under the MIT License, which means:
openSource.list1: The source code is freely available and can be modified, distributed, and used for any purpose;
openSource.list2: There are no trademark restrictions - the name 'Parsertime' is not trademarked;
openSource.list3: You are free to fork, modify, and create derivative works of the software.

useOfService.title: Use of Service
useOfService.description: While Parsertime is open source, when using our hosted service you agree to:
useOfService.list1: Use the service for its intended purpose of analyzing Overwatch scrims;
useOfService.list2: Not attempt to overload or disrupt our servers;
useOfService.list3: Respect other users and maintain appropriate conduct;
useOfService.list4: Not use the service for any illegal or harmful activities.

userAccounts.title: User Accounts
userAccounts.description: When you create an account with us, you must provide information that is accurate, complete, and current at all times. You are responsible for:
userAccounts.list1: Safeguarding the password and all activities that occur under your account;
userAccounts.list2: Notifying us immediately upon becoming aware of any breach of security or unauthorized use of your account;
userAccounts.list3: Ensuring that your account information remains accurate and up-to-date.

prohibitedUses.title: Prohibited Uses
prohibitedUses.description: You may not use our service:
prohibitedUses.list1: For any unlawful purpose or to solicit others to perform unlawful acts;
prohibitedUses.list2: To violate any international, federal, provincial, or state regulations, rules, laws, or local ordinances;
prohibitedUses.list3: To harass, abuse, insult, harm, defame, slander, disparage, intimidate, or discriminate;
prohibitedUses.list4: To submit false or misleading information or to interfere with the proper functioning of the service;
prohibitedUses.list5: To attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems or other users' accounts.
prohibitedUses.list6: To upload, post, or share NSFW, pornographic, sexually explicit, or otherwise adult content.

abuseAndMisuse.title: Abuse and Misuse
abuseAndMisuse.description: We reserve the right to take action against users who abuse or misuse our service:
abuseAndMisuse.list1: Accounts may be suspended or terminated for violations of these terms;
abuseAndMisuse.list2: We may implement rate limiting or other technical measures to prevent abuse;
abuseAndMisuse.list3: Repeated violations may result in permanent bans from the service.

disclaimers.title: Disclaimers
disclaimers.description: The information on this website is provided on an 'as is' basis. To the fullest extent permitted by law, we exclude all representations, warranties, conditions and terms relating to our website and the use of this website.

limitationOfLiability.title: Limitation of Liability
limitationOfLiability.description: In no event shall Parsertime, nor its contributors, be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including without limitation, loss of profits, data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses, resulting from your use of the service.

termination.title: Termination
termination.description: We may terminate or suspend your account and bar access to the service immediately, without prior notice or liability, under our sole discretion, for any reason whatsoever and without limitation, including but not limited to a breach of the Terms.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law
governingLaw.description: These Terms shall be interpreted and governed by the laws of the United States, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Our failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms will not be considered a waiver of those rights.

changesToTerms.title: Changes to Terms
changesToTerms.description: We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to modify or replace these Terms at any time. If a revision is material, we will provide at least 30 days notice prior to any new terms taking effect.

contactUs.title: Contact Information
contactUs.description: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at <link>legal@lux.dev</link>.
